Sentencas: In the present work, 1 wt% and 5 wt% Pd/GDC10 (Gd-0.1 Ce0.9O1.95) nanopowders were prepared by two different methods: (a) cation complexation (CC) and (b) incipient wetness impregnation (WI) of an aqueous Pd2+ solution onto GDC10 nanopowders.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: All samples were characterised by X-ray diffraction (XRD), thermal analysis (TG/DTA), specific surface area determination and high resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM).
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: In order to study the oxidation state of Pd in samples with and without reducing treatments, XANES experiments at the Pd L-3-edge were carried out.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: In situ Ce L-3-edge XANES experiments were performed under reducing conditions in order to investigate the reduction behaviour of these materials.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: The addition of Pd to the GDC10 nanopowders increased the reducibility of Ce in the mixed oxide.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: Finally, catalytic tests for CH4 combustion were performed on the Pd/GDC10 nanopowders.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: Catalysts with higher Pd loading (5 wt%) exhibited the best performance for CH4 combustion.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion

Sentencas: The influence of preparation method was evident for catalysts with 1 wt% Pd, the cation complexation method resulting in more active catalysts than the wetness impregnation method.
Titulo: Reduction and catalytic behaviour of nanostructured Pd/gadolinia-doped ceria catalysts for methane combustion
